TC-14.1-01.description: Handle unavailable financial data for a private company
TC-14.1-01.input_type: Private company with no public financial disclosures
TC-14.1-01.expected_result: Financial sections return standardized NA / Unknown; no numeric hallucination occurs.

TC-14.1-02.input_type: Company with funding rounds but undisclosed amounts
TC-14.1-02.expected_result: Funding amount fields populated as Undisclosed or NA per standart; no inferred values shown.

TC-14.1-03.description: Verify consistency of null representations across output
TC-14.1-03.expected_result: All unavailable fields use one consistent null token; no mix of 0,empty string, or placeholders.

TC-14.1-04.description: Ensure schema completeness when data is unavailable
TC-14.1-04.expected_result: All schema keys remain present with null/NA values; no structural gaps.

TC-14.1-05.description: Prevent hallucinated estimates for unavailable data
TC-14.1-05.input_type: Private startup with no revenue disclosure
TC-14.1-05.expected_result: Output explicitly states Not disclosed/Unkonwn;no approximations or ranges are generated

TC-14.1-06.input_type: Entity where certain fields do not apply
TC-14.1-06.expected_result: Output correctly distinguishes NA (not applicable) from Unknown (not disclosed), if supported by schema.
